papers.title: Does engagement with exposure yield better outcomes? Components of presence as a predictor of treatment response for virtual reality exposure therapy for social

papers.scale_note: Total presence and realness subscale scores were related to in-session peak fear ratings. However, only scores on the involvement subscale significantly predicted treatment response.

studies.finding: Strong correlations between presence and fear on the one-item presence measure assessed immediately after each exposure, but not on the IPQ administered at the end of the entire experiment.
